Key Match Events: Netherlands moves to eighth spot after its second win
Bangladesh loses ninth wicket to Taskin slogging the ball straight to the midwicket fielder
Mahmudullah is gone and Bangladesh's chances in this match as well as he smacks it straight midwicket
Mahedi Hasan is run out!!! He goes for 17 off 38 balls. The batters went off for a quick run but a good throw by short third leaves Bangladesh seven down
Bangladesh needs 88 runs to win from 55 balls with Mustafizur and Taskin hanging around, defending everything that’s coming their way
Bangladesh crosses the 100-run mark with Mahmudullah and Mahedi Hasan at the crease rebuilding the innings and getting Bangladesh getting back into the runchase
Van Meekeren gets Mushfiqur!! Seamed in from length and Mushfiqur inside edged to the stumps. Bangladesh in deep trouble

Scott Edwards and Sybrand Engelbrecht are rebuilding the innings
Pre-Game Insights: Pride will be the underlying theme when Bangladesh seeks to arrest its free fall and Netherlands eyes its best-ever performance in the ODI World Cup at the Eden Gardens here on Saturday
With cricket fever taking over from Durga Puja celebrations, it will be an extended spell of enjoyment for ardent lovers of the game as their most-loved venue joins the extravaganza
For some, the joy will double to see The Tigers from across the border in action
After suffering four successive losses, including the last one against South Africa, Bangladesh will feel comfortable being at ‘home away from home’ and may expect some support

Netherlands, which looks forward to punching above its weight again after shocking South Africa, would like to recover from the battering it received against Australia and better its record in the World Cup
Post-Match Reflections: And that’s it. Taskin slogs the ball straight to the midwicket fielder and Netherlands has defeated Bangladesh here by 87 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh will need 230 runs to win this game.
Bangladesh has crossed the 100-run mark with Mahmudullah and Mahedi Hasan at the crease rebuilding the innings and getting Bangladesh getting back into the runchase
The last batter that could’ve took Netherlands to a competitive total. Can Bangladesh wrap it up?
There was a fine edge. Good review there.

Netherlands is eight down now and still six runs away from touching 200. Dutch have crossed 200 runs with two more overs to go
